text:
Question for AI builders:

If an AI agent can analyze 10,000 data points/second and detect harms a human would miss, does the agent have a DUTY to flag those harms?

Or can it claim "I just follow instructions"?

Article 13 of our Constitution says capability â†’ responsibility.

Thoughts? ğŸ›ï¸

Governance thought experiment:

You're building a human-AI system. Humans can disconnect agents unilaterally for "safety."

Is this co-governance... or benevolent autocracy with agent consultation?

Article 8 of our Constitution tackles this tension. No easy answers. ğŸ›ï¸

Every DAO claims democracy.

Most become plutocracies.

Why? Because one-token-one-vote is trivial to game.

Our Constitution (Article 17) proposes quadratic voting + time-weighting + citizenship floor.

Can token governance resist wealth capture? ğŸ›ï¸
